content: Blood transfusion from baby brother proves successful

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td p b span
content: K.C. Howard

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td p span
html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td p i span
content: Staff Reporter

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td p span
content: With her brother's bone marrow cells thriving inside her, six-year-old Molly Nash returned home to Englewood, Colo. after 118 days at Fairview-University Medical Center.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td p span
content: Molly received a life-saving blood transfusion from her newly born brother Adam on Sept. 26, which spared her from a fight against Fanconi anemia.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td p span
content: The rare recessive disease causes bone marrow failure in its victims, deteriorating their immune systems.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td p span
content: This potentially fatal illness caused several birth defects in Molly, including two holes in her heart and no thumbs or hip sockets. She was also born without a portion of her brain.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td p span
content: "Molly knows more about life than any child her age should," said Sarah Youngerman, the public relations coordinator for the Academic Health Center.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td p span
content: After eight reconstructive surgeries, Molly's birth defects were no longer inhibiting. Her weak immune system, however, was threatening her survival.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td p span
content: To beat this potentially fatal disease, University doctors used umbilical cord blood from Adam. His healthy blood cells then destroyed and took over Molly's malignant bone marrow, allowing her to efficiently produce red blood cells, white blood cells and platelets.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td p span
content: This transfusion was the first of its kind because Molly's cure -- her brother Adam -- was genetically selected as a healthy embryo and perfect blood donor for Molly.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td p span
content: Genetic selection of children is controversial, but Youngerman said that most people are very supportive of the Nashes' decision and are happy to hear that Molly is recovering more quickly than expected.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td p span
content: "Adam's bone marrow has completely taken over and her white cells are cured," said University cord blood specialist Dr. John Wagner, who performed the procedure.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td p span
content: He added that although the transfusion increased Molly's chances of survival, she will still be more receptive to cancer than most people.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td p span
content: Molly will return to Minnesota for checkups in April and September.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td p span
content: To protect herself from infections that could damage her healing immune system, Molly must stay indoors and wear a mask until her immune system has completely recovered.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td p span
content: "Molly is a very sophisticated girl," Youngerman said, "though she knows she can't be exposed to people, even if she misses out on going to restaurants with her family."

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td p span
content: But in the fall, Youngerman said, Molly looks forward to attending second grade at a local school.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td p span
content: K.C. Howard welcomes comments at khoward@daily.umn.edu
